H0.text: Hair is an anatomical structure that insulates, protects, and provides sensory input.

H1.text: Teeth are anatomical structures that insulate, protect, and provide sensory input.

H2.text: Fingernails insulate, protect, and provide sensory input.

H3.text: Salivary glands insulate, protect, and provide sensory input.

A4.text: Hair also has a sensory function, extending the sense of touch beyond the surface of the skin.

A5.text: Hair provides thermal regulation and camouflage for many animals; for others it provides signals to other animals such as warnings, mating, or other communicative displays; and for some animals hair provides defensive functions and, rarely, even offensive protection.
